remarks: Definition of the conditional operator for propositions.  The value of ` if- ( ph , ps , ch ) ` is ` ps ` if ` ph ` is true and ` ch ` if ` ph ` false.  See ~ dfifp2 , ~ dfifp3 , ~ dfifp4 , ~ dfifp5 , ~ dfifp6 and ~ dfifp7 for alternate definitions.  (Contributed by BJ, 22-Jun-2019.)
statement: df-ifp $p |- ( if- ( ph , ps , ch ) <-> ( ( ph /\ ps ) \/ ( -. ph /\ ch ) ) ) $.
